content.description:
Good Ol Slab Climbing, between the waterfall and Romatica.  Clean Rock, Good Position, Nice Moves and ends at a large Bench.

P1 starts at the large tan hanger and goes up and left around the bushes.
content.protection: 2 pitches you need about 12-14 draws (11 bolts on the first pitch along with gear placements) and gear to about 2 inches with emphasis on the small stuff (orange tcu and smaller)
content.location: This is the first route right of the waterfall dihedral.  Can be in the waterfall in the early part of the year.

content.description:
P1: 5.9+ 80' -  Uphill from Romantica, there is a bolt at a good stance.  Precise Footwork up the face gets you to a small roof. awkward step left and up leads to lower angled ground. Belay at large bench.

P2: 5.10b 100' - Staying in the trough past several bolts.  reach a friction crux to a short wide flake crack.  Crack widens then step left at bulge.  Lower Angle terrain to a bolted belay.

Descent: Rap route or Walk off the big Bench
content.protection:
Typ Spring Mtn Rack

Gear 2"

Draws and Slings

Bolted Anchors/Raps
content.location: From the Twin Cairns, hike up and right to the Waterfall. Continue past Vitamin R and Romantica till you see the next line of Bolts

content.description: Moderate line toward the right side of Dodge Dart slab. Nondescript line but fun climbing on quality clean rock. Often dry during spring melt-off season when little else is.
content.protection: Four bolts and fixed anchor.  Can sling vine maple bush at steep move after first bolt
content.location: Locate using bolts - lowest on the slab. Can descend with single 60.

climbs.name: Romantica
climbs.fa: Hanna, Karner, Bolach, Perkins, Packard, Gamage, & Whitelaw

content.description:
Located just right of the waterfall dihedral.  It is currently the longest route at Spring Mtn and was climbed and cleaned on several visits.

P1: 5.9 - 155' Begin 30' to the right of the waterfall, climbing a slabby rib with bolts.  A steep short headwall  is a lil tricky. Move up and left  through waves and features. Another overlap notch lead to gear protected face climbing. Belay at low angle bench

P2: 5.8+ Steep moves crank up the center of the watercourse feature, leading to an overlap. Step up and locate an emerging rib (bolts) with some nice pure friction moves towards the top.  This  is the big bench, Move belay up and right about 60'

P3: 5.10b  A steep start below a small roof, heads up throug a series of enjoyable layback flakes and overlaps up to 5.9.  Step right to the clean and steep face. Belay at a comfortable stance below a small cedar grove.

P4: 5.10a  Move left of trees to gain a nice hand crack in blocky terrain. Layback a flake and mantle to an exposed ledge.  Delicate face climbing leads to an undercling flake. Step out and left to the Hueco Belay

P5: 5.9  Cruiser. A few face moves off the belay lead near a tree. A schist band with intersecting incut features has great exposure. leads to an alcove belay.

P6: 5.9  Climb up and around a corner. a single steep pullup leads to lower angled slab climbing. still within the schist band.  This route tops out to the east of the large waterfall notch.

Pitch Descriptions by M. Hanna

A great Trip Report of

Romantica and Other Side of the Tracks

with pictures showing the nature of Spring Mountain
content.protection:
Gear to 3"

Many long slings.

Bolted Anchors/Raps

2 Ropes for descent.
content.location: From the Twin Cairns, Follow the trail up and right to the toe of a large buttress (base of the Cloven Roof). Continue right to the first rock wash then head up for 50'. traverse right to the next rock wash and follow that up to a small clearing. Romatica is the second route right of the waterfall.

climbs.name: Forgotten Youth
climbs.fa: FA: Hanna & JR Storms '08, FFA: Packard

content.description: Step Left across the hopefully dry waterfall. Climb up low angle rib, stay left of the arete, clip the bolts going up the face. Mantle the crux to the anchor. Easier if you're taller.
content.protection:
Maybe a piece down low.

Bolts to the top.

Anchor on top
content.location: Route is located immediately left of the waterfall dihedral.

content.description: Nice moderate route toward the middle of DD Slab, about 40 feet left of Shapely Apes. Quality rock and good climbing.
content.protection: Four bolts and small rack to 2".
content.location:
Find blocky ramp coming up from right - bolts are difficult to see from ground. Angle up and left toward a small headwall, place small pro, pull steep moves and continue up bolted slab.

Bolt anchors for rappel using 70m or double ropes. Or can walk off to right, starting with an exposed slabby traverse. Or stop at Shapely Apes anchor for a single rope rappel. Or, if you don't like any of those options, trigger your PLB  for a helicopter rescue!
